required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Primary Prevention With Statin and Incidence of Recurrent MI and Cardiogenic Shock in Post-ACS Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Primary Prevention With Statin and Incidence of Recurrent Myocardial Infarction and Cardiogenic Shock in Post-Acute Coronary Syndrome Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effect of statin for primary prevention, towards lowering the incidence of recurrent myocardial infarction, cardiogenic shock and mortality in ACS patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Adult patients (≥ 18 years of age) with acute coronary syndrome which are diagnosed under ICD-10 coding of I24.9 were included in this study. The inclusion criteria are patients with primary diagnosis of I24.9 and with a complete record of prior medical and treatment history, electrocardiographic findings, cardiac marker results and outcomes. Participants were grouped into 2 groups - statin and non-statin based on prior history of statin use prior to ACS. Diagnosis of ACS was made based on clinical, electrocardiographic and cardiac marker findings found in the medical record.
Data such as age, sex, ethnic, education, prior medical and treatment history, electrocardiographic and cardiac enzyme results as well as outcomes were collected from the patients' medical records. Outcomes of interest were defined as either recurrent myocardial infarction, cardiogenic shock, mortality or combinations of them as diagnosed in the medical records. GRACE and TIMI Scores are calculated to predict in hospital and future mortality rates.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Clinical Diagnosis of Recurrent Myocardial Infarction reported in medical records

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Clinical Diagnosis of Cardiogenic Shock reported in medical records

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Patient death reported in medical records

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
other_outcome.description: GRACE (Global Registry of Acute Coronary Events) mortality risk score

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year
other_outcome.description: Thrombolysis In Myocardial Infarction (TIMI) mortality risk score

arm_group.description: History of statin use for primary prevention
No documented history of statin use prior to Acute Coronary Syndrome

intervention.description: Prescribed with statins for primary prevention

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients (≥ 18 years of age) with acute coronary syndrome which are diagnosed under International Classification of Diseases (ICD)10 coding of I24.9

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of Acute Coronary Syndrome
- Presence of detail on statin prescription history
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unavailability of electrocardiographic findings, cardiac marker results, GRACE and TIMI score parameters
- Incomplete records of prior medical and treatment history

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Cardiology, Faculty of Medicine, Tarumanagara University
